intro: Delphinium saccatum, commonly known as the sac囊 delphinium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, adorned with large, showy blue to purple flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Delphinium saccatum is also noted for its attractive seed heads that persist into the fall, adding interest to the garden throughout the growing season.
